item.title: Setting Subdomain Cloudflare for hugo website in github page
item.description: If you’re using the Hugo framework to deploy your site on GitHub Pages and you’re experiencing issues with missing styles or incorrect layout after setting up a subdomain through Cloudflare, there are a few things to check and configure. Here’s a detailed guide to ensure that everything works smoothly. 1. Check the baseURL in Hugo’s Configuration The baseURL setting in Hugo’s config.toml (or config.yaml or config.json, depending on your setup) is critical for making sure your site works correctly with a custom subdomain or domain.
